affiliations.name: Państwowa Akademia Nauk Stosowanych w Nysie

results.title: Najważniejsze rozwiązania przyjęte w ramach Unii Europejskiej w zakresie zwalczania cyberzagrożeń

abstracts.content: Celem artykułu jest przedstawienie najważniejszych, w ocenie autora, obowiązujących aktualnie regulacji przyjętych w ramach Unii Europejskiej, służących zwalczaniu różnego rodzaju cyberzagrożeń. Po krótkim wstępie nakreślającym charakter oraz skalę niebezpieczeństw wynikających z ceberataków, jak również akcentującym potrzebę połączenia sił przez państwa UE w celu podjęcia skutecznej walki z nimi, w pierwszej kolejności omówione zostały postanowienia Strategii cyberbezpieczeństwa UE z grudnia 2020 roku, następnie zaś przepisy regulujące organizację i funkcjonowanie ENISA, czyli Agencji Unii Europejskiej do spraw Cyberbezpieczeństwa. Całość zakończona została podsumowaniem, w którym najpierw streszczono najważniejsze poruszone w artykule kwestie, a następnie przedstawiona została opinia autora dotycząca adekwatności przyjętych rozwiązań do stwarzanych zagrożeń.

The aim of the article is to present the most important, in the author's opinion, currently applicable regulations adopted in the European Union in order to eliminate various types of cyberthreats. After a short introduction outlining the nature and scale of the dangers resulting from cyberattacks, as well as emphasizing the need for EU countries to join forces in order to effectively fight them, first of all, the provisions of the EU's Cybersecurity Strategy for the Digital Decade were discussed, and then the provisions regulating the organization and functioning ENISA (previous name European Network and Information Security Agency). The entire study ended with a summary, which first recalled the most important issues raised in the article, and then presented the author's opinion on the adequacy of the adopted solutions to the threats posed.

otherTitles.title: The most important solutions adopted within the European Union to eliminate cyberthreats

results.title: Effectiveness and mediators of change of an online CBT intervention for students with adjustment disorder—study protocol for a randomized controlled trial

abstracts.content: Background Adjustment problems and disorders are highly prevalent among university students worldwide. These problems can cause signifcant interference in academic and social functioning and increase vulnerability to other mental health disorders. Unfortunately, only half of students in need receive psychological help. Furthermore, few studies have evaluated psychological interventions for adjustment disorders in students. New, more scalable forms of treatment for students with an adjustment disorder need to be developed, evaluated, and implemented. The study aims to determine the efectiveness of an online transdiagnostic cognitive behavioural intervention for students experiencing adjustment disorder and to assess mediators of change. Method/design In this three-arm randomized controlled trial, we plan to recruit 214 Polish students diagnosed with an adjustment disorder. Participants who meet initial eligibility criteria will be randomly assigned to one of three 6-week conditions: (1) online cognitive behavioural therapy intervention based on an existing, empirically supported transdiagnostic protocol, the unifed protocol; (2) online progressive muscle relaxation training as an active control group; or (3) waiting-list control group. Both interventions are asynchronous, interactive, and include minimal amount of therapist support. Assessments will consist of self-report questionnaires, daily diary measures, and neurocognitive tasks for evaluating cognitive functioning. These will be conducted at baseline, post-treatment, and 1-month followup. Daily diary measures will be taken during the frst and last week of treatment (or waitlist period). Primary outcome measures will include adjustment disorder severity; secondary outcome measures will consist of other negative (psychopathology: depression, anxiety, and stress) and positive (life satisfaction) indexes of mental health as well as process measures (e.g. mindfulness, experiential avoidance, cognitive fusion). Discussion To our knowledge, the current study is the frst to evaluate the efectiveness of a psychological intervention for students with adjustment disorder. Therefore, it may have important practical implications for students with this disorder. It can potentially guide the development of a scalable, validated treatment option.

results.title: Factors Underpinning the Shift to Eveningness during Early Adolescence: Pubertal Development and Family Conflicts

abstracts.content:
Biological and psychosocial factors have been related to the shift to eveningness during early adolescence but it is necessary to study them from a longitudinal perspective. This longitudinal study examined the contribution of these factors to the onset of a shift towards eveningness in early adolescence. A sample of 440 (49.9% boys) Spanish adolescents were assessed for pubertal development, family conflicts, and morningness/eveningness. The same measures were taken twice at the age of 12 and one year later (T1: M = 12.47, SD = 0.75 and T2: M = 13.64, SD = 0.78). Pubertal development and family conflicts were considered predictors of morningness/eveningness in a mixed-effects multilevel model. The developmental shift towards eveningness appeared in girls but not in boys. The shift was related to more advanced pubertal development and more conflicts in the family. This study has implications for shaping healthy sleep habits in adolescents and possible
interventions focused on family dynamics

book.title: Hidden dimensions : aspects of Mesolithic hunter-gatherer landscape use and non-lithic technology

results.title: Bone flakes from traditional metapodial reduction in postglacial deposits

abstracts.content:
To better understand technological change during the Stone Age, various methods for the
production of splinters that form the basis for the manufacture of bone tools have recently
been studied. It is now generally assumed that the manner in which bone splinters were
extracted from animal bones depends on the culturally rooted working tradition of the
craftspeople. Unfortunately, examinations of specific bone artefacts displaying regular flake
scars rarely consider how the bone blanks they were made from were exactly produced.
Therefore, artefacts displaying negatives of removals that represent a specific stage in the
reduction of the bone and possible subsequent discard of debitage, are of particular interest:
the ‘knapped’ animal bones and the flakes deriving from them. In Mesolithic Europe, the first
known bone flakes record the ‘calibration’ (preparation) of metapodials of large ungulates
for further manufacture. Together with the bone flakes removed in this way, they represent
the first stage using the wedge-splinter technique. The second stage consists of the splitting
or grooving of the tubular bones prepared in this way into splinters, mainly used for bone
point production. At sites where flakes, splinters and other diagnostic items are present and
found in situ, this opens up the possibility to refit the bone fragments and to thus demonstrate
a common Mesolithic bone reduction method. At sites with only one or another type of
debris present in situ, it can still be possible to gain insight into this manufacturing process,
as well as the function of the excavated sites where it was observed. To enable identification
of this technique in preserved Mesolithic bone deposits, this paper presents some of the
archaeological materials with the different preparation stages represented, as well as the
results from an experiment conducted in 2017 and on the ‘calibration’ stage alone.

results.title: Supporting Risk Management in Finance through the Use of ICT. A Systematic Literature Review

abstracts.content:
Zarządzanie ryzykiem to funkcja wykonywana w każdym przedsiębiorstwie.
Odgrywa jednak szczególnie ważną rolę w organizacjach z branży finansowej. Obecnie na
rynku dostępnych jest wiele narzędzi teleinformatycznych, które ułatwiają proces zarządzania
ryzykiem w firmach. Autorzy zaobserwowali następujący problem badawczy, jakim jest opisana
w literaturze tendencja wykorzystania ICT w zarządzaniu ryzykiem finansowym. Celem
pracy jest ukazanie związku pomiędzy zarządzaniem ryzykiem w finansach a narzędziami
ICT w literaturze. Metoda badawcza to statystyczny, systematyczny przegląd literatury. Badania
objęły 5 baz danych: Scopus, Web of Science, IEEE Xplore, ScienceDirect i Google
Scholar. Zakres poszukiwań obejmował okres od 2010 do 2021 roku.

Risk management is a function performed in every enterprise. However, it plays
a particularly important role in organizations from the financial industry. Currently, there
are many ICT tools available on the market that facilitate the risk management process in
companies. The authors examined the following research problem, namely the tendency of
the use of ICT in financial risk management described in the literature. The aim was to show
the relation between risk management in finance and ICT tools in the literature. The research
method was a statistical systematic literature review which covered five databases: Scopus,
Web of Science, IEEE Xplore, ScienceDirect and Google Scholar, over the period from 2010
to 2021.
